ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own it 	 yet...
ygData.msgSnippet: If that s the direction you want to take.. Well all I can say is you won t be able to play any future games anyways until you do a minimum upgrade to your
ygData.messageBody:
If that's the direction you want to take.. Well all I can say is you won't
be able to play any future games anyways until you do a minimum upgrade to
your system. Like it or not, it's a fact. Get a 30$ video card and play
the old everquest.. If ya cant afford that then ya can afford the expansion
software itself.

Ah well.. :(

-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2001 7:29 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own it
yet...



Well, some people can barely afford the computers they have as well as
Everquest, much less afford to upgrade... Verant should work harder on
making the game compatible with lower end systems rather than forcing their
customers to upgrade or quit. luv, -Su

> Hardware is fairly inexpensive these days. If your into computers and
games
> in particular you will have to stay slightly ahead of the curve.
Currently
> you can pick up memory pretty cheap.. I got mine from
> googlegear.com..
They
> have 512megs of memory for as low as 60$ Keep in mind that only a few
years
> ago that could have cost you up to 1$ per meg. Besides they released
> the requirements for Luclin months ago, there was time to upgrade
> prior. You can still certainly play the previous Everquest as well as
> the prior expansions without changing much if anything.. If it's the
> directx 8 problem, you can pick up compatiable cards (geforce2 MXs)
> for as low as
35$.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: alexander.jones@...
> [mailto:alexander.jones@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 11, 2001 4:23 AM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own
> it yet...
>
>
> Old puters work just fine. The only problem you have is that your
> video
card
> *MUST* be dx8 certified. Other than that even going as low as 128 megs
will
> work. There is not the slightest chance in hell you can install luclin
> on that machine tho, cause it will die while trying to render the new
graphics.
>
> And you should really get more ram, it isnt that expensive. Ram and a
> nice video card and everything works a lot smoother. CPU power isnt
> that important.
>
> 512mb for $100 isnt steep. And your machine needs to be nicely
> configured. For example if you run WinXP old world eq and me would be
> like 256 megs to run ok but on 98 128 works ok and 160 is fine.
>
> And dont be so negative, SoL is a whopping expansion worth the new
> specs. Graphics are cool (some char models are a bit weird) but
> mobs/surrondings are very nice. The mob features are a LOT improved
> adding more tactics to fights.
>
> /Alex
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Sent: den 11 december 2001 10:02

*do*

> just
have
